text: Paul Hermann Müller (January 12, 1899 – October 12, 1965) was an Swiss chemist. He won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1948 for his discovery of insecticidal qualities and use of DDT in the control of vector diseases. He was born on January 12, 1899 in Olten, Switzerland and died on October 12, 1965 in Basel, Switzerland. ==References== Category:1899 births Category:1965 deaths category:Swiss chemists Category:Swiss Nobel Prize winners Category:Olten District Category:People from the canton of Solothurn
title: Paul Hermann Müller
